byline.original: By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

lead_paragraph: Two lawyers representing Morris Zukerman, accused of avoiding $45 million in taxes, were compelled to appear before a grand jury investigating him.

headline.print_headline: Lawyers Ordered to Testify on Client’s Case
headline.main: Lawyers Ordered to Testify on Client’s Tax Evasion Case

snippet: Two lawyers representing Morris Zukerman, accused of avoiding $45 million in taxes, were compelled to appear before a grand jury investigating him.
abstract: Prominent lawyers James A Bruton III and James T Fuller III,  partners at Williams & Connolly, are ordered to testify before federal grand jury in case of their client Morris E Zukerman, oil investor and banker accused of failing to pay $45 million in taxes; unusual directive from judge was upheld by federal appeals panel, and Zukerman has waived his right to raise conflict of interest on lawyers' part as future issue; Zukerman is seeking plea bargain.
